title: juice not woth the squeeze
text:
It would be great if companies participating, who KNOW HOW MUCH FOOD THEY THROW AWAY, were connected to this app for the same reason of those of us less fortunate. 

The experiences i have found is that im am looked at with derision and am given overloads of carbs( rice ) with less than a full portion of the items they will throw away at the end of the night.  

The app is a great idea. But after 5 purchases, i am done.  I can make my own rice with a paltry carb( a root vegtable of potato or carrort, onion, celery, etc‚Ä¶side, and not be insulted by knowing the trays of protien food will get tossed 1hr later, regardless of me atemptimg this format. they would rather throw it away than serve it a discount has been my experience.  app is a great idea. but doesnt work in practice on the ground level.

title: Cool concept, but needs improvement
text: I love the concept of eliminating food waste and providing more affordable options for eating out. I would just improve the app by allowing there to be some way to let the restaurants know about allergens or food preferences. For example, I can‚Äôt eat beef or pork and I have no way of telling the restaurant to not put either in my order unless I called ahead. I also have dairy allergies so it would be nice to be able to know what food you‚Äôre getting. I think the surprise bag of food is a nice concept for people with easy palates but I would like to know what I‚Äôm spending money on because if it‚Äôs something I can‚Äôt eat, the food gets wasted either way.

title: Beware
text: App is a good concept, but you are at the mercy of the establishment. I showed up to pick up my order within the required time window, and the employee told me he was going to the back to get it. Since he told me he was going to bring my food out, I clicked the picked up button. I thought clicking this was necessary to get the food. He came back and said he had no food for me. Now, I cannot get my money back. No customer service. And, really, who wants to spend 30 minutes on the phone for a few dollars? This makes me wonder how many businesses are collecting these small payments without actually providing the product the customer paid for?

title: Making a Difference Bite by Bite
text: Too Good To Go is a standout app that's revolutionizing the way we handle food waste, seamlessly connecting users with local businesses to rescue unsold food. It's smart, simple to navigate, and offers an incredible variety of options. With each meal you save, you're not just getting a deal; you're contributing to a greener planet. It's an effortless way to make a difference‚Äîand enjoy some delicious discoveries along the way. Having used the app for a couple of months, I've noticed that in a 20 mile radius around Pittsburgh, participation is limited with only 2 businesses on board. While the concept is brilliant, a wider network of participating businesses would enhance the experience and impact of this eco-friendly initiative.

title: Breuklyn Pizza
text: Tiana and Francisco made my 1st to Breuklyn Pizza to enjoy ‚Äò2Gd2Go‚Äô an absolutely delightful experience! Am a fan of delicious, cheesy pizzas. Reckoning that I will be back every week!
